title: A Strange Signal
description: One of the men finds a radio. It picks up a faint but distinct signal, repeating a sequence of numbers. They sound like coordinates. It could be something worth investigating... or it could be a trap. What should we do?

options.text: Shady - We have to check it out! Discovery is how we survive! If we never take risks, we’ll never find anything worth finding.
options.outcome: The scouting party returns battered but successful. They bring back two survivors and a small cache of food, though the trip drained energy reserves.

options.text: Old-Timer - We don’t need to chase ghosts. We enhance the radio instead—pick up more signals and maybe even send one out. Could be real hope out there.
options.outcome: With some engineering, the radio is improved. Soon, faint music plays over the speakers, lifting spirits. Maybe there’s still something out there…

options.text: Beck - The men need a day off, not some wild goose chase. Let them rest, recover, and enjoy the moment. We can’t chase every mystery.
options.outcome: The workers take a well-earned break, boosting morale. However, without scavenging or production, food stocks take a hit.
